metadata.description: Template configuration for claude-export customization. Contains all 50+ variables organized by category for reusable AI agent system.
metadata.author: MeatyPrompts Team

PROJECT_NAME.description: Project or organization name used in agent descriptions, templates, and configuration

PROJECT_DESCRIPTION.description: Brief description of the project and its primary purpose

PROJECT_DOMAIN.description: Primary business domain or industry of the project

PROJECT_ARCHITECTURE.description: System architecture description explaining how layers and components interact
examples: Monolith with clear separation of concerns

LAYER_ARCHITECTURE.description: Detailed breakdown of architectural layers from database to deployment
LAYER_ARCHITECTURE.default:
1. Database Layer (schema, migrations, RLS)
2. Repository Layer (data access, queries)
3. Service Layer (business logic, DTOs)
4. API Layer (routes, validation)
5. UI Layer (components, hooks)
6. Testing Layer (unit, integration, E2E)
7. Documentation Layer (API, Storybook)
8. Deployment Layer (feature flags, monitoring)
examples: 8-layer breakdown (DB → Repo → Service → API → UI → Tests → Docs → Deployment)

ARCHITECTURE_DIAGRAM.description: URL to architecture diagram or ASCII art representation of system architecture

PROJECT_STANDARDS.description: Core standards and patterns enforced across the codebase
PROJECT_STANDARDS.default: Layered architecture, DTOs in separate modules, RLS enforcement, OpenTelemetry observability, error envelopes, cursor pagination
examples: Layered architecture, DTOs separate, RLS enforcement, OpenTelemetry, error envelopes, cursor pagination
Microservices pattern, domain-driven design, CQRS separation

VALIDATION_RULES.description: Task completion and code validation criteria specific to the project
VALIDATION_RULES.default: MeatyPrompts patterns, error envelopes, pagination, RLS enforcement, observability instrumentation
examples: Error envelopes, cursor pagination, RLS, observability
TypeScript strict mode, test coverage >80%, no console.log
No TODO comments, documented public APIs, type coverage

NAMING_CONVENTION.description: Naming conventions for tasks, issues, branches, and identifiers
NAMING_CONVENTION.default: PREFIX-NUMBER format (e.g., FEAT-123), kebab-case slugs, semantic versioning

CODE_QUALITY_STANDARDS.description: Code quality expectations and enforcement rules
CODE_QUALITY_STANDARDS.default: No SQL in services, DTOs separate from ORM, 80%+ test coverage, OpenTelemetry instrumentation
examples: No SQL in services, DTOs separate, 80%+ coverage, OpenTelemetry
SonarQube grade A, no code smells, security scans passing
Type safety, linting compliance, security audit passing

PM_WORKFLOW.description: Primary product management tool and workflow system

TASK_TRACKER.description: Task tracking system name (often same as PM_WORKFLOW)

SPRINT_DURATION.description: Sprint duration in days (use 'Continuous' for flow-based development)

APPROVAL_WORKFLOW.description: Code review and approval process for PRs/MRs

DOC_POLICY.default: Document only when explicitly needed, in allowed buckets, or for tracking. Avoid over-documentation.
examples: Document only when explicitly needed in allowed buckets
Comprehensive documentation for all public APIs
Minimal docs, prioritize code clarity over documentation

DOC_BUCKETS.default: User Documentation, Developer Documentation, Architecture & Design, README Files, Configuration, Testing, Product Planning, Tracking Documentation
examples: User Docs, Developer Docs, Architecture, README, Config, Tests, Product, Tracking
API Docs, Integration Guides, Setup Guides, FAQs
Architecture ADRs, Design System, Component Specs

ADR_PATH.description: Location where Architecture Decision Records are stored

DOC_FRONTMATTER.description: Required YAML frontmatter fields for documentation files
DOC_FRONTMATTER.default: title, description, audience, tags, created, updated, category, status, related
examples: title, description, audience, tags, created, updated, category, status

OBSERVABILITY_REQUIRED.description: Whether observability (logging, tracing, metrics) is required in the project

LOGGING_FORMAT.description: Standard logging format for application logs

PERMISSIONS.description: Tool permissions configuration for Claude Code (deny/ask/allow rules)

HOOKS.description: Pre/post tool-use hooks for Claude Code integration

AUTH_METHOD.description: Primary authentication method for the application

ENV_GATE_SECRET.description: Secret for development authentication bypass (32+ chars, generated)
examples: Keep this secret in settings.local.json only

PROJECT_PATHS.description: Project directory structure and key paths
examples: MeatyPrompts structure: api, web, mobile, ui, tokens
Flat structure with src/, test/, docs/

EXCLUDED_PATHS.description: Paths to exclude from analysis and symbol generation

SYMBOL_FILES.description: Symbol file locations and domain mappings
examples: Layered symbol files by architecture tier

BACKEND_LANGUAGE.description: Primary backend programming language and version

UI_LIBRARY.description: UI component library and styling approach

PROJECT_EXAMPLES.description: Real code examples and patterns from the project codebase
PROJECT_EXAMPLES.default: See examples/ directory for MeatyPrompts-specific examples

EXAMPLE_FEATURE.description: A real feature example to illustrate project patterns

EXAMPLE_ARCHITECTURE.description: Detailed example of the project's architecture
EXAMPLE_ARCHITECTURE.default: Full MeatyPrompts 8-layer architecture with routers, services, repositories, and database

EXAMPLE_ERROR_HANDLING.description: Example of proper error handling in the project
EXAMPLE_ERROR_HANDLING.default: ErrorResponse envelope with error code, message, details, and request_id
examples: Error envelope with code, message, details

COMPLEXITY_SCALE.default: S (1-3 days), M (4-7 days), L (1-2 weeks), XL (3+ weeks)

examples: Rule-based agent routing with confidence scores

CONFIG_VERSION.description: Version of this configuration format (not project version)

SCHEMA_VERSION.description: Version of the configuration JSON schema

notes.IMPORTANT_NOTES: This template contains all 50+ variables organized by category. Each variable includes description, default value, required status, type, and examples. Use this as a reference for customizing the claude-export system for your project.
notes.USAGE: Replace default values with your project-specific values. Required variables must be customized. For new projects, start with this file and customize the identity, architecture, standards, and workflow sections.
notes.CUSTOMIZATION_GUIDE: See TEMPLATIZATION_GUIDE.md for comprehensive documentation on each variable, how they're used in agents/templates, and step-by-step customization instructions.
NEXT_STEPS: 1. Copy this file to your project as config/template-config.json or .claude-config.json
2. Replace all default values with your project-specific values
3. Create project-specific symbol files and configuration
4. Test with an agent: Task('codebase-explorer', 'Find all components')
5. Customize example files in examples/ directory
